original_title: ADB to support Sri Lanka water sector reforms
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has expressed willingness to provide knowledge and technical support to reform Sri Lanka’s water sector, a statement by the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

“ADB was willing to provide the necessary knowledge and technical support for Sri Lanka’s new reform operation program in the water supply sector, along with capacity building projects of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board,” a statement by the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

Sagala Ratnayake, President’s Senior Advisor on National Security and Takafumi Kadono, Mission Director of the ADB had discussed the plans and monitoring framework for the water supply sector in Sri Lanka.
The support includes capacity building projects at the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSD). (COLOMBO/July06/2023)
